title: Formal Advisory Opinion Request to Florida Bar Unlicensed Practice of Law Documents

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records created pursuant to the request for a formal advisory opinion submitted on 4/23/2023 to the Florida Bar’s Unlicensed Practice of Law listed below: 

I am writing to request a formal advisory opinion on whether pro se use of Casetext's CoCounsel would constitute the unlicensed practice of law.
 
Casetext's CoCounsel is a legal AI assistant that can perform various tasks, such as document review, legal research memos, deposition preparation, and contract analysis. According to a study by Casetext and Stanford CodeX, GPT-4 scored approximately 297 points on the UBE, which is higher than the passing threshold for all UBE jurisdictions. This score places GPT-4 in the 90th percentile of test-takers.
 
I am a pro se litigant who is interested in using Casetext's CoCounsel to prepare and file legal documents for my case. I understand that Casetext's CoCounsel does not provide legal advice or representation, and that I am solely responsible for the accuracy and legality of my documents.
 
However, I am concerned that using Casetext's CoCounsel may be considered the unlicensed practice of law under Rule 10-2.1 of the Rules Regulating The Florida Bar, which defines the practice of law as "the giving of legal advice or legal assistance to another person". I am also aware that Rule 10-9.1 allows the Standing Committee on Unlicensed Practice of Law to issue proposed formal advisory opinions concerning activities which may constitute the unlicensed practice of law.
 
Therefore, I respectfully request that the Standing Committee on Unlicensed Practice of Law issue a formal advisory opinion on whether pro se use of Casetext's CoCounsel would constitute the unlicensed practice of law in Florida.
 
Thank you for your time and attention.
 
Sincerely,
 
Michael Locke
127 Delvalle St. 
Melbourne Beach, FL 32951 
Mbl22885@msn.com
(321)506-9557

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Michael Locke

title: FOIL Request for Information on Executive Order No. 4.20

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Information on Executive Order No. 4.20
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of records and documents related to Executive Order No. 4.20, issued by Governor Kathy Hochul on April 22, 2023, which continues the declaration of a statewide disaster emergency due to healthcare staffing shortages in the State of New York.

Specifically, I am requesting the following information:
1. Data and statistics on the extent of staffing shortages in hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the state, including but not limited to the number of vacant positions, the distribution of these vacancies by facility type and location, and the projected timeline for staffing shortages to continue.

2. Any analyses or reports detailing the impacts of the severe understaffing on critical care provision and the ability to serve vulnerable populations, including estimated patient outcomes, increased wait times, and reduced accessibility to healthcare services.

3. Records and documents relating to the immediate and critical need for supplemental staffing, including the specific measures taken to ensure that hospitals and healthcare facilities are adequately staffed during the disaster emergency.

4. Information on the option analyses conducted to review non-emergency alternatives for addressing healthcare staffing issues, including but not limited to the evaluation of potential programs, initiatives, or other policy options that did not result in the declaration of a state of emergency.

5. Records and documents related to the funding inadequacy for the non-emergency alternatives considered, detailing the reasons why these alternatives were deemed insufficient to address the staffing crisis and the decision-making process leading to the issuance of Executive Order No. 4.20.

6. Information on other possible executive orders that were considered but not enacted in response to the healthcare staffing shortages, including their contents, reasons for dismissal, and any related cost-benefit analyses.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Utah Animal and Livestock Mutilations

communications.subject: Government Records Access and Management Act Request: Utah Animal and Livestock Mutilations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request any and all files in connection with animal or livestock mutilations from 1967 through 2022. I believe these records are under the purview of the Utah Department of Agriculture and Food (UDAF).

As a citizen of the United States, I am entitled to access public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. I request that you provide me with copies of all records, documents, notes, reports, and any other material related to animal or livestock mutilations that have been investigated by the Utah Department of Agriculture and Food (UDAF) from January 1, 1967, to December 31, 2022.

Please provide me with any available information regarding the following:

The number of reported animal or livestock mutilations in Utah from 1967 to 2022.
The locations of the reported animal or livestock mutilations.
The number of investigations launched into these incidents.
The results of the investigations, including any reports, conclusions, or findings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nathan Isaac

title: Request for IRB Application for Study on Top Surgery and Gender Dysphoria (Northwestern University)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request a copy of the Institutional Review Board (IRB) application for the study titled "Top surgery and chest dysphoria among transmasculine and nonbinary adolescents and young adults," conducted by researchers at the University of Illinois and Northwestern University. 

This research was funded/supported by Northwestern University Clinical and Translational Sciences Institute, funded in part by a Clinical and Translational Science Award grant from the National Institutes of Health (UL1TR001422) that contributed to collection, management, analysis, and interpretation of the data. I understand that the IRB materials I am requesting may be stored under any of the following study identification numbers for your research protocols: SP0052757, UL1TR001422, or NCT04195659. Please provide the relevant documents associated with these identifiers in accordance with my request.

I am requesting the IRB application submitted for approval prior to the commencement of the study and any amendments/modifications filed after the study began.  I am not asking for any identified participant data (IPD).

Journal: JAMA Pediatrics
Title: "Top Surgery and Chest Dysphoria Among Transmasculine and Nonbinary Adolescents and Young Adults"
Published online: September 26, 2002
Principle Investigators: Mona Ascha and Sumanas W. Jordan
Funding: Northwestern University Clinical and Translational Sciences Institute is funded in part by a Clinical and Translational Science Award grant from the National Institutes of Health (UL1TR001422) 

Given that your study has received federal funding through the NIH, it falls under the purview of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). As such, I am entitled to request access to the following documents and information related to your research:
    Consent and assent templates, along with any modifications.
    Study information templates.
    Recruitment templates and worksheets.
    Details on potential risks or benefits to participants.
    Comprehensive research protocol, including study design, data management and analysis, and ethical considerations.
    Any additional documents required for review by the IRB.
    Submissions pertaining to any modifications made to previously approved research within this study.

Additionally, please provide me with the name and contact information of the official who will review my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ann Sauseda

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wyoming Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to request any and all files in connection with animal or livestock mutilations from 1967 through 2022. I believe these records are under the purview of the Wyoming Livestock Board, Special Investigator division.

As a citizen of the United States, I am entitled to access public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. I request that you provide me with copies of all records, documents, notes, reports, and any other material related to animal or livestock mutilations that have been investigated by the Wyoming Livestock Board's Special Investigator division from January 1, 1967, to December 31, 2022.

Please provide me with any available information regarding the following:

The number of reported animal or livestock mutilations in Wyoming from 1967 to 2022.
The locations of the reported animal or livestock mutilations.
The number of investigations launched into these incidents.
The results of the investigations, including any reports, conclusions, or findings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nathan Isaac

title: Request for Records on NYPD Mounted Unit Horses

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Records on NYPD Mounted Unit Horses
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any  and all records, including but not limited to emails, memos, physical documents, standing orders  and any other records, related to NYPD police horses from January 1st, 2020, to the present date.

Please provide the following information for each NYPD police horse during the aforementioned timeframe:

Name and badge number of the horse
Breed and sex of the horse
Dates of service for the horse
Any complaints or disciplinary actions against the horse or its handler(s)
Additionally, please provide any records related to court cases or legal proceedings involving NYPD police horses during the aforementioned timeframe.

Please note that the requested records do not hinder any police techniques or investigations. Also, please do not withhold, redact, or delete any responsive records, as I will take legal action to compel their disclosure, and will file a complaint with the appropriate authorities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Anderson County Sheriff Department (Tenn.) investigation into library books

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Anderson County Sheriff Department (Tenn.) investigation into library books
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any letter, email, text message, or other correspondence concerning any complaint or investigation concerning the content of books, materials, or programs at any public library. . This includes, but is not limited to any correspondence sent to received from any County Commissioner, the County Law Director (or any Assistant Law Director), the District Attorney (or any Assistant District Attorney), and any complainant or witness to such an investigation.

2. The letter from Sheriff Barker to the County Commission (or its members) stating that: "Both books appear to have a political agenda that promotes a specific ideology related to gender and sexuality, which may be confusing or potentially harmful to young readers who are still developing their understanding of these concepts."

3. A copy of the March 29, 2023 opinion by Anderson County District Attorney General David Clark concerning library books.

4. Any complaints, incident reports, narrative reports, or other records relating to any complaint or investigation concerning the content of books, materials, or programs at any public library. 

5. Any records generated or received in connection with any investigation concerning the content of books, materials, or programs at any public library. This includes any records referenced in any complaint or incident report concerning such an investigation. These records may also include photographs, video, or body camera footage generated or received during the investigation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

title: FOIA - FBI - SST Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - SST Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records mentioning and/or relating to SST Records - an American independent music record label formed in 1978 in Long Beach, California by musician Greg Ginn (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SST_Records).

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

Please see the following news publication to serve as proof of death: https://www.tabletmag.com/sections/history/articles/the-purge-chandler-davis

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CCC 4.20.23
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of all Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) records, documents, and communications responsive to case file 94-HQ-50997, for the Campus Crusade for Christ, aka Cru. The group was founded by William R. Bright, aka Bill Bright (October 19, 1921 – July 19, 2003), as an evangelical ministry for college students in 1951. Some of the information in the case file is publicly available courtesy of writer Lerone A. Martin, who identifies communications between Campus Crusade leaders and former FBI director J. Edgar Hoover in his book "The Gospel of J. Edgar Hoover: How the FBI Aided and Abetted the Rise of White Christian Nationalism", published in April 2023, but the file itself has not been made public. This would be of public interest for two reasons:

First, it would contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government. Hoover, per Martin, used the Campus Crusade as a vehicle to promote his personal and professional interests. The Campus Crusade distributed Bureau materials and Hoover's writing appeared in a 1962 issue of a Campus Crusade publication, The Collegiate Challenge, in an article titled “Freedom Begins with Christ”. The Campus Crusade's file would provide the public with a clearer understanding of J. Edgar Hoover's relationship with faith leaders during his tenure as FBI director.

Second, during its existence, the Campus Crusade has maintained associations with known domestic terrorist organizations such as the Covenant, the Sword, the Arm and the Lord (CSA), an anti-government militia group and member of the Christian identity movement which bought farmland from the Campus Crusade in the early 1980s (please see: 100-HQ-487200). Per the FBI case file on the CSA, the Bureau launched a multi-year investigation into the group, culminating in a 1985 raid on the property the CSA purchased from the Campus Crusade. The Campus Crusade's interactions with domestic terrorist organizations make it a subject of public interest.

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. My bylines, which include Creem Magazine, Covert Action Magazine, and the Geopolitical Economy Report, can be found in both print and electronic publications. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

title: Request for Incident at 25th Precinct on April 19th, 2023 Involving Officer Justin (Badge Number 9991) and Other Officers.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Incident at 25th Precinct on April 19th, 2023 Involving Officer Justin (Badge Number 9991) and Other Officers.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pertaining to an incident that occurred at the 25th precinct around 9:50 pm on April 19th, 2023, involving Officer Justin (badge number 9991) and any other officers involved in the incident.

Specifically, I am requesting all complaints filed against these officers for the past 2 years, as well as any depositions and complaint records related to this incident. I am particularly interested in any records related to any officer who claimed that recording in public is wrongful or any officer who accosted a member of the public for recording in public.

In addition, I am requesting any video recordings, including body camera footage and lobby footage, related to this incident. I request that you do not withhold or redact any records, and I would appreciate it if you could provide me with any case law that supports your decision to release these records.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving the requested records in a timely manner.

Sincerely,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: Records Related to Distribution of Military Equipment to Law Enforcement Agencies under the 1033 Program and Homeland Security Grant Program for the Past Five Years

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Related to Distribution of Military Equipment to Law Enforcement Agencies under the 1033 Program and Homeland Security Grant Program for the Past Five Years
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Related to the distribution of military equipment to law enforcement agencies under the 1033 Program, as well as any related information on the Homeland Security Grant Program, for the past five years. Specifically, I am requesting the following information:

Records of all requests made by law enforcement agencies for surplus military equipment, including the types of equipment requested and the justification for the request.
Records of all equipment distributed to law enforcement agencies under the 1033 Program and the Homeland Security Grant Program, including the types of equipment distributed, the quantity, and the receiving agencies.
Policies and procedures governing the distribution of surplus military equipment to law enforcement agencies, as well as any relevant guidance or training materials.
Records of any incidents involving the use of surplus military equipment by law enforcement agencies, including any investigations, disciplinary actions, or reports.
I request that any responsive records be provided to me without redactions or withholdings, except in cases where redactions or withholdings are required by law. Please note that the FOIA requires that any redactions or withholdings be limited to only the specific information that is exempt from disclosure under the FOIA, and that the agency must provide a justification for any such redactions or withholdings.

I also note that the FOIA requires agencies to provide the requested information in a timely manner. If the requested information is not provided within 20 business days, I reserve the right to pursue all legal remedies available to me.

To support my FOIA request, I would like to reference the case law of Judicial Watch, Inc. v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1113 (D.C. Cir. 2004), which holds that “governmental agencies bear the burden of showing that requested documents are exempt from disclosure under FOIA.” I would also like to reference the case law of Martin v. Dep’t of Justice, 488 F. Supp. 2d 443, 454 (D.D.C. 2007), which holds that “FOIA exemptions are to be narrowly construed, with any doubts resolved in favor of disclosure.”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

04/20/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR144792 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013588-041923 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
( x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
(x ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Ana Diaz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

title: Mask Mandates

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails, memos, letters, documents and other records discussing or mentioning implemented or proposed mask mandate policies, as well as discussions regarding their expiration or termination between January 1, 2020 and the present.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000 readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Emma North-Best.

title: Records Related to Hydraulic Fracturing (Fracking) in New York State for the Past Five Years

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Records Related to Hydraulic Fracturing (Fracking) in New York State for the Past Five Years
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Related to hydraulic fracturing (fracking) activities in the state of New York over the past five years.

As a concerned citizen, I am interested in understanding the policies and practices that NY DEC employs to regulate and monitor fracking operations in the state. I am requesting any records in the possession of the NY DEC that pertain to the following:

Permits and applications for fracking operations submitted to the NY DEC, including but not limited to drilling permits and environmental impact assessments.
Records of inspections and enforcement actions taken by the NY DEC to ensure compliance with state regulations and environmental standards.
Records related to any spills, accidents, or other incidents related to fracking operations in the state of New York.
Records related to studies or research conducted by the NY DEC or other state agencies regarding the environmental impacts of fracking.
I request that you do not withhold or redact any responsive records, as I intend to pursue all available legal remedies, including filing a lawsuit to compel the production of records, if necessary.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR144769 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013587-041923 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
( x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
( x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
(x ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Ana Diaz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

title: US COAST GUARD ACADEMY - Applicant review

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: US COAST GUARD ACADEMY - Applicant review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The requested information should apply to the graduating class of 2027. 

1.	Coast Guard Academy Admission Partner Program requirements defined and recognized by the Coast Guard Academy Director of Admissions, Superintendent Instruction.
2.	Guidelines, standards, requirements for Appointments to Cadetship prescribed by the Secretary, including age limits, methods of selection of applicants, term of service as a cadet before graduation, and all other matters affecting such appointment.  All relevant standards required for appointment, admission, training, graduation, and commissioning.
3.	Applicants review process from submission to CEBB review process, recommendations to the Secretary for Appointment. 
4.	Process for errors in transcript by High School directly to USCGA admissions. 
5.	Appeals process for applicants. 
6.	Process for handling Candidate inquiries from State Representatives, and Congress member offering support of a candidate. 
7.	Pre-selection process for recruiting efforts, pre-selected candidates, target metrics. 
8.	Number of Applicants offered an appointment with a GPA of 3.7 or lower. 
9.	Number of Applicants offered an appointment with a PFE score of 200 or lower. 
10.	Number of Applicants offered an appointment without a Chemistry class on their High School transcript. 
11.	Number of Applicants offered an appointment without a Calculus class on their transcript. 
12.	Number of Applicants offered an appointment without Calculus and Chemistry on their High School Transcript. 
13.	Number of Applicants offered an appointment without 1 year or less of community service. 
14.	Number of Applicants offered an appointment who did not play Varsity Sports in High School. 
15.	Number of Applicants offered an appointment who played 2 years or less Varsity Sports. 
16.	Number of 1st time applicants offered an appointment for 2023. 
17.	Number of applicants offered an appointment for the USCGA Class of 2027 (existing seniors in high school). 
18.	Number of applicants offered an appointment who resided more than 200 miles away from Academy and DID NOT attend an ONSITE event at the Academy. 
19.	Number of applicants offered an appointment with 1 year or less of Leadership experience. 
20.	Number of applicants offered an appointment who are considered "HOOKS", have a tie to the Academy in some way. Family ties, parents' association, board, alumni, or tied to staff in some way. 
21.	Number of applicants offered an appointment with a household income of less than 60,000.00.
22.	Number of applicants offered an appointment with a family income greater than 100,000.00.
23.	USCGA definition of Inclusion and how it is applied during the application review and selection process. 
24.	Academy process to rectify any mistakes during the application review process. Checks and balances, forms, all related documentation used to catch errors, mistakes, omissions.
25.	Include any and all forms, documents used in the application review process. 
26. Number of applicants offered an appointment AFTER April 2nd.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sally Jones

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking any and all documents, reports, photographs, audio recordings, and video recordings pertaining to the incident, including but not limited to:

Police reports
Witness statements
Accident reports
911 call recordings
Body camera footage
Dashcam footage
Photos of the scene

The incident involved an individual who either jumped or fell off an overpass, hitting a car on the freeway below and killing the driver, Marisa Harris. The incident was investigated by the Virginia State Police.

To assist in identifying the records I am seeking, please note the following information:

Date of incident: October 28, 2017
Location of incident: Interstate 66 at Cedar Ln overpass
Victim's name: Marisa Harris

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents related to Nova Tech, Cynthia Petion and Eddie Petion in relation to the Wisconsin Department of Financial Institutions and Division of Securities actions for case S-246552 (EX), and/or California Department of Financial Protection & Innovation Disast and Refrain Order pertaining to the same.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Cory Lewkowitz

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Request for information on NovaTech (Wisconsin Department Of Financial Institutions)
communications.communication:
Pursuant to s. 551.607(2)(a), Stats., the department does not release or make available for public examination records and information obtained by the administrator in connection with a pending investigation/open case under s. 551.602.   Once the case is closed, the records are releasable as public records.

Because the department has denied all or a part of your records request, pursuant to s. 19.35(4)(b), Stats., I am required to inform you that this determination is subject to review by mandamus under s. 19.37(1) or upon application to the attorney general or a district attorney.

Sincerely,

Chris Green

Christopher N. Green
Assistant Chief Legal Counsel
Wisconsin Department of Financial Institutions
Email: Chris.Green1@dfi.wisconsin.gov<mailto:Chris.Green1@dfi.wisconsin.gov>
Cell: (608) 716-9687
Website: dfi.wi.gov<https://dfi.wi.gov/>

communications.subject: PRA0865 : Public Records Request Confirmation
communications.communication:
Your California Public Records Act (PRA) request has been received by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI). Once we have reviewed your PRA request, we will provide you with DFPI’s determination as to whether your request seeks, in whole or in part, disclosable copies of public records within 10 to 24 days of receipt (see Government Code section 6253(c)). For reference, your PRA request has been assigned the tracking number PRA0865. 
Should you have additional questions about the status of your request, please email us at communications@dfpi.ca.gov. (mailto:communications@dfpi.ca.gov) 
 
Thank you, 
California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation 
2101 Arena Blvd 
Sacramento, CA 95834 
(866) 275-2677 (tel:8662752677)
